# locale

**Instance Property**

The locale to use when formatting date and time values.

## Declaration

```swift
var locale: Locale! { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value of this property is the current user’s locale, which is accessible from the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale/current] method of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale]. You can change this value to a different locale to generate strings based on that locale.

## Configuring the Formatter Options

- **dateStyle**: The style to use when formatting day, month, and year information.
- **timeStyle**: The style to use when formatting hour, minute, and second information.
- **dateTemplate**: The template for formatting one date and time value.
- **calendar**: The calendar to use for date values.
- **timeZone**: The time zone with which to specify time values.
